identity_pool.description: Deploys an AWS Cognito Identity Pool. API Gateway sits on the front of your API and handles accepting and processing API calls

resources.description: Each key at the base level of this object must specify a route (e.g. /soar). Then, each value should be an object with additional route keys and/or HTTP methods as keys (e.g. PATCH). The route keys should have as their value either an HTTP endpoint, a lambda component reference, a lambda ARN, or a list with the first element being one of the three previously mentioned strings and the second element being the name of an authorizer. http://NOTHEREYET for examples.

cors_configuration.description: If you want to specify a custom CORS configuration to attach to this API, pass this parameter

allowOrigins.description: Set to "*" to allow all origins. Otherwise set to a list of origins

allowMethods.description: Set to "*" to allow all methods. Otherwise set to a list of methods

allowHeaders.description: Set to a list of headers for Access-control-allow-headers in CORS

exposeHeaders.description: Set to a list of headers for Access-control-expose-headers in CORS

authorizers.description: A dictionary of the JWT and Lambda authorizers that should be attached to this API

audience.description: The audience that the JWT authorizer should validate against

audiences.description: A list of audiences the JWT authorizer should validate against

connect_url.description: Cognito endpoint to get issuer from. Only set for Cognito JWT issuers

source.description: The header to get the JWT from. Only set if you want a header other than Authorization

lambda_arn.description: The ARN for the desired authorizer Lambda

payload_version.description: The event format passed to Lambdas by API Gateway. We recommend 2.0. See https://docs.aws.amazon.com/apigateway/latest/developerguide/http-api-develop-integrations-lambda.html for a comparison of the two and more details

enable_simple_responses.description: Whether to allow the authorizer to return a boolean value only

cache_seconds.description: How long to cache this Authorizer result

stage_variables.description: key-value pairs of variables that should get attached to the stage

lambda_payload_version.description: The event format passed to Lambdas by API Gateway. We recommend 2.0. See https://docs.aws.amazon.com/apigateway/latest/developerguide/http-api-develop-integrations-lambda.html for a comparison of the two and more details

throttling_burst_limit.description: The default burst limit for all routes

throttling_rate_limit.description: The default rate limit for all routes

cors_enabled.description: If true (and cors_configuration not specified), sets the cors configuration to a set of default values intended to service basic APIs being hit by the browser. See http://NotHereYet for details

tags.description: A set of key-value pairs to attach to this API Gateway as tags

name.description: The name of the API Gateway. Will be auto-generated if not specified

stage_name.description: The name of the stage, this is added to the URL of the API for all endpoints

domain_names.description: A list of domain names to point at this API

domain_name.description: The (singular) domain name to point at this API

base_domain.description: Pass a base domain to get a unique domain through a generated subdomain

log_group_arn.description: The ARN of the log group associated with this API

log_group_name.description: The name of the log group associated with this API

api_id.description: The ID of this API. Appears in the default HTTP endpoint

name.description: The name of this API, as it appears in the console

api_endpoint.description: The default HTTPS endpoint of this API

stage_name.description: The name of the deployed stage

Route53 (num).description: Contains the properties of any route53.record components deployed, with num corresponding to the order within the list of domain_names, counting up from 1

Domain (num).description: Contains the properties of any domain_name components deployed, with num corresponding to the order within the list of domain_names, counting up from 1

user_pool.description: Deploys an Cognito User Pool. User Pools are used to authenticate users and manage user data.

certificate_arn.description: The ARN of the ACM certificate that is used when hitting this domain name

hosted_zone_id.description: The hosted zone ID of this domain name

api_gateway_domain_name.description: An AWS-internal domain name for the API

tags.description: A set of key-value pairs to attach to this API Gateway custom domain name as tags
